posts.post_content: I loved the expression on my opponent's face in draft when he attacked me with this, searched my deck, and I respond with "I didn't get any artifacts." :D

posts.post_content:
[Cosi's Trickster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cosi's Trickster) can pump itself with this card even if opponent does have an equipment card. Just search and mess his deck up and shuffle again! good especially when he use ponder,   
[Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor)'s brain storm effect, or maybe even a vampire deck.
posts.html:
Cosi's Trickster can pump itself with this card even if opponent does have an equipment card. Just search and mess his deck up and shuffle again! good especially when he use ponder,
Jace, the Mind Sculptor's brain storm effect, or maybe even a vampire deck.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: JosirisDavid (2/5/2010 7:43:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Of importance, you get to "play the card" from the exile zone. Which means you must pay its casting cost to play it. So no easy snag of a Darksteel Colosus.
posts.html:
Of importance, you get to "play the card" from the exile zone. Which means you must pay its casting cost to play it. So no easy snag of a Darksteel Colosus.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Elliott_ATL (2/7/2010 8:36:16 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Omniance: The word 'card' is the key there. If it said Artifact spell, then yes, it would be cast that spell. However, because it refers to the artifact as a card, and not a spell, saying 'play' the card is appropriate.
posts.html:
Omniance: The word 'card' is the key there. If it said Artifact spell, then yes, it would be cast that spell. However, because it refers to the artifact as a card, and not a spell, saying 'play' the card is appropriate.

posts.post_content:
Potentially devastating.  
  
Even if you don't have the amount or colors to cast whatever you snatch, at the very least they can't either~  
  
Edit:  
They clearly had older formats in mind when they crafted her up.  
The use of the word 'play' instead of 'cast' allows you to snatch and play their artifact lands.
posts.html:
Potentially devastating.

posts.post_content: I was thinking more along the lines of a mono-blue deck putting 2 in it's side board in standard, if you have the room, and if they're using islands nail them with their own [Pithing Needle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pithing Needle) while you still have 4 of your own. Basically give yourself 6 chances for Pithing Needle.

posts.post_content:
Isn't the text on this card misprinted? Shouldn't it read:   
  
"Whenever Thada Adel, Acquisitor deals combat damage to a player, search that player's library for an artifact card and exile it. Then that player shuffles his or her library. Until end of turn, you may ***cast*** that card."?
posts.html:
Isn't the text on this card misprinted? Shouldn't it read:

"Whenever Thada Adel, Acquisitor deals combat damage to a player, search that player's library for an artifact card and exile it. Then that player shuffles his or her library. Until end of turn, you may cast that card."?
